title: John Cheney-Lippold, We Are Data: Algorithms and the Making of Our Digital Selves
abstract: approach. There remain doubts about the whole enterprise – whether it is opportunistic or timely, whether it seizes the moment or is woolly headed in its grasp of social and cultural change, among various other points of scepticism – but the book helps a great deal in setting out what has been achieved thus far and in having a strong sense of what should ensue hereafter. Students in particular will find the book a helpful and highly informed introduction to this new field sitting adjacent, as it does, to the long-established field of media and communication studies.
